column4: Charles says, « Hello there, <Class>. Have you ever gotten tired of playing the same game over and over ? That’s what it’s like here. All the adults say we can do is sit here and play ‘Truth or Dare’. Sure, it was fun at first, but most of us have gotten bored and Raymond’s too chicken to do any of the dares I think for him. »\n\nCharles says, « It was a lot more fun when we could play ‘Spin the Elixir’ in the tavern basement with the girls, but Tiff’s parents caught us there and we’ve been treated like babies ever since. I bet this game would be a whole lot better if you could [join] us. I’d even kick Raymond out and think up the bestest dare evern just for you. »
column7: Charles says, « Hmmm. Give me a minute. I know just the thing. The guards keep talking about a big, scary statue in the demon dungeon beyond the limit of the town. I dare you to go in and touch it, and come back out without getting eaten by a monster ! What do you say ? »
column9: Charles says, « You made it back alive ! I mean, uh, welcome back ! How was the statue ? »

column8: Charles has dared you to touch the statue in the center of Nergal’s section of the Demon’s Breach dungeon. Travel a short distance northeast of Mularn’s bindstone to find the dungeon entrance.
column9: Return to Charles in Mularn and let him know you’ve completed his dare.

column7: Charles says, « Great, we’ll, uh, wait right here while you go do it. See, Raymond, not everyone’s a big chicken like you. Chicken ! »
column8: You’ve reached the statue of Charles told you about. Return to him and let him know you’re completed his dare.
